Description: Hollow-cast copper alloy figure in the form of Bastet, standing and wearing elaborately patterned dress, holding sistrum in right hand, inscribed aegis in left, standing on open-work platform, 2 cats at front of base, one broken, hole in base.
Curator's comments: Delvaux in Les divins chats d’Égypte (eds. L. Delvaux and E. Warmenbol). Leuven: 133, fig.62
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands 1989/90 Oct-Feb, Brussels, Institut Royal Des Sciences Nasturelles Des Belgique, The Cats of the Pharaohs 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2009 Apr-present, Swaffham Museum, Egyptian Gallery, LT Loan
